items.title: Mammals that chose ants and termites as food almost never go back

ai_summary: Research indicates mammals specializing in ants and termites rarely change diets.
The study examined the dietary habits of various ant and termite-eating mammals.
Once a mammal adopts this diet, it typically remains consistent throughout its life.
This dietary specialization is a significant evolutionary adaptation for mammals.
The research provides insights into the long-term ecological impacts of diet.
